intro: Spiranthes exigua, commonly known as the narrow-leaved ladies' tresses, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the orchid family (Orchidaceae) and is characterized by its delicate, spiraling arrangement of small white or greenish flowers. The plant typically grows in wet or moist habitats such as bogs, marshes, and along stream banks. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces a tall, flowering stem that can reach up to 30 inches in height. Spiranthes exigua is often found in shaded environments and is known for its subtle beauty and ecological importance in supporting pollinators.
